citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee was not treating the eyes, nose, and ears of an adult male Boston Terrier (ID# 23224) that contained
discharge. Yellow-green discharge was seen adjacent to both eyes and in the left nostril. The ears contained dark brown
to black discharge. The animal was not seen squinting or irritating the eyes or ears. The animal was also not seen
breathing abnormally. Failure to treat problems of animal health can lead to delays in providing proper care to animals
resulting in worsening of their condition. The licensee must maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include
the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee must ensure
that all animals receive adequate veterinary care at all times. Correct by ensuring that the animal is examined and treated
by a licensed veterinarian. Correct by 3-FEB-2025.

The primary enclosure failed to contain an animal securely. An adult female Dalmatian French Bulldog Cross (#6255)
escaped from the enclosure during the inspection. The animal jumped over the gate of the outside run. The animal was
recovered without injury. Animals that can escape their enclosures are at an increased risk for injury or serious accidents
which may lead to pain, distress, or even death. Correct by ensuring that primary enclosures are constructed and
maintained so that they contain the animals securely. Correct by 28-JAN-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee was not treating the eyes, nose, and ears of an adult male Boston Terrier (ID# 23224) that contained 
discharge. Yellow-green discharge was seen adjacent to both eyes and in the left nostril. The ears contained dark brown 
to black discharge. The animal was not seen squinting or irritating the eyes or ears. The animal was also not seen 
breathing abnormally. Failure to treat problems of animal health can lead to delays in providing proper care to animals 
resulting in worsening of their condition. The licensee must maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include 
the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee must ensure 
that all animals receive adequate veterinary care at all times. Correct by ensuring that the animal is examined and treated 
by a licensed veterinarian. Correct by 3-FEB-2025. 
3.6(a)(2)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The primary enclosure failed to contain an animal securely. An adult female Dalmatian French Bulldog Cross (#6255) 
escaped from the enclosure during the inspection. The animal jumped over the gate of the outside run. The animal was 
recovered without injury. Animals that can escape their enclosures are at an increased risk for injury or serious accidents 
which may lead to pain, distress, or even death. Correct by ensuring that primary enclosures are constructed and 
maintained so that they contain the animals securely. Correct by 28-JAN-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
